intro: Oxytropis besseyi var. obnapiformis, commonly known as the oblongleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale purple to white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland habitats. Oxytropis besseyi var. obnapiformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
